Complete topic title: Violence & Intolerance in Medieval Society
Persecution, violence, and intolerance were a persistent strain that shaped much of Middle Ages (500-1500 CE) and its interactions with religious minorities and deviant insiders, such as lepers, prostitutes, and the indigent poor. This course deals with difficult topics: racial/religious discrimination, violence aimed at Jews and Muslims, enslavement, torture, sexual assault, and forced prostitution.


(Freshmen Only)
course_description: Introduces first-year students to the discipline of history, particularly historical sources and methods; aims to improve critical reading, analytical, and writing skills in small group discussion.
